alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 8:17PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, southeastern Sequoyah and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 817 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Arkoma, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Alma... Barling... Roland... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Moffett... Rudy... Figure Five... Fort Smith Regional Airport... Kibler... Concord... Shibley... Braden... Mill Creek... Cottonwood... Dora... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 18. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 320 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
